trends: There have been 7 other sightings in Paso Robles
There were no other sightings in Paso Robles on or around September 17th 2011
Summary: Twin lights that appeared to be an extra star in the Big Dipper.
divs: Sighting DetailsI was driving in the vicinity of Paso Robles CA and pulled off the highway onto an unknown rural road to get some rest. The night was so clear, I stepped out of my car to enjoy the lack of urban sky glow. I am an amateur astronomer, and a long-time sky-watcher and satellite watcher. I've experimented with astrophotography and consider myself to be a sane and intelligent individual. Looking up, I noticed an extra "star" in the handle of the big dipper. I did a double-take thinking it must be a passing plane or satellite and watched as two lights about a degree apart went from being stationary and started moving West, then did an abrupt U-turn and shot out of sight at a speed that was remarkable. I don't know of any man-made phenomenon that would explain this.
